If it makes you feel any better, it isn't because you're not using "pure" ubuntu and we're being elitist. It's because some of the base-level things that 'other distros' change really make it difficult to apply ubuntu-specific support to those other distros. A classic example is how Backtrack's networking behaves, by default, completely unlike anything Ubuntu has ever acted like.
